intro: Themistoclesia geniculata, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
